The [British] Library respects the intellectual property rights, including moral rights, of rights holders and makes all reasonable effort to contact and consult rights owners, including, where appropriate, communities directly, or via local community organisations. Given the importance of the historical record, and the fact that that some of our digitised collections include materials that are sensitive to particular communities and groups, we ask that any use of the digitised collections is undertaken with the appropriate care. Irrespective of its copyright status, items and/or collections should not be altered or used in ways that might be derogatory to the originating individuals or communities. notesStmt.note: Defective at the beginning and at the end. On guards.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: A festival prayer book, according to the (old) French rite.

msItem.title: A series of ma῾arivim shel Pesaḥ
A series of ma῾arivim shel Shavu῾ot
A series of ma῾arivim shel Rosh ha-Shanah
The prayers for Rosh ha-Shanah and Yom Kipur

collation.p: Quires of mostly 8 leaves each. Catchwords at the end of the quires.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Ashkenazi square and semi-cursive scripts, punctuated, of the 13th to 14th century.

binding.p: BM/BL in-house. Spine: 'Mahazor. Hebrew. Brit. Mus. Oriental MS 2735.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Chaim M. Horowitz: purchased by the British Museum from him on 26 January 1884 (folio [186v])
